perturbation.original_text: 2.6. INVENTORY MANAGEMENT AND USE OF EXISTING INVENTORY. All                purchasing of inventory, use of inventory, and management of                inventory shall be performed by Contractor according to this                Agreement, and APPENDIX C.
perturbation.changed_text: 2.6. INVENTORY MANAGEMENT AND USE OF EXISTING INVENTORY. All                purchasing of inventory, use of inventory, and management of                inventory shall be performed by Contractor according to this                Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the reference to 'APPENDIX C,' which should detail costs and inventory commitments, creates an omission. perturbation.original_text: 3.5. CHANGE ORDERS. Throughout all the assembly phases of a Product                during the Production Lead Time and any time before the Due Date,                NICE may issue Contractor with a Change Order. The issuance of                such Change Order and the execution by Contractor of such Change                Order, shall be in accordance with the provisions hereunder. Upon                issuance of a Change Order, Contractor will immediately execute                it and the Product price shall change in accordance with APPENDIX                C. The sole implication of a Change Order will be payment for                additional direct labor costs as detailed in APPENDIX C. Replaced                components and sub-assemblies will be returned to Contractor's                inventory at no charge to NICE (without derogating from the                specific provisions of this Agreement under which NICE is                obligated to purchase Permitted Components). The Product price                will be as after the implementation of the Change Order. For                Change Orders issued prior to commencement of the Production Lead                Time for any Product no charge will be incurred by NICE. Without                derogating from the aforementioned, Contractor will not charge                NICE for Change Orders during the first three (3) months of                production.
perturbation.changed_text: 3.5. CHANGE ORDERS. Throughout all the assembly phases of a Product during the Production Lead Time and any time before the Due Date, NICE may issue Contractor with a Change Order. The issuance of such Change Order and the execution by Contractor of such Change Order, shall be in accordance with the provisions hereunder. Upon issuance of a Change Order, Contractor will immediately execute it and the Product price shall change in accordance with internal process. The sole implication of a Change Order will be payment for additional direct labor costs. Replaced components and sub-assemblies will be returned to Contractor's inventory at no charge to NICE (without derogating from the specific provisions of this Agreement under which NICE is obligated to purchase Permitted Components). The Product price will be as after the implementation of the Change Order. For Change Orders issued prior to commencement of the Production Lead Time for any Product no charge will be incurred by NICE. Without derogating from the aforementioned, Contractor will not charge NICE for Change Orders during the first three (3) months of production.
perturbation.explanation: The removal of the reference to APPENDIX C regarding change order pricing creates an internal contradiction. Several sentences explicitly state that APPENDIX C dictates change order costs. Removing this reference creates uncertainty, since the prices for implementing these changes are undefined. It introduces a big conflict with the prices stated.
